alert.note: Alert for Lower Rio Grande Valley; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; South Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 6:38PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL SOCORRO COUNTY THROUGH 715 PM MDT... At 638 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bernardo, or 14 miles south of Belen, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Veguita, Bernardo, La Joya, San Acacia, Chamizal, Las Nutrias, Sabinal, Abeytas, and Contreras. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 158 and 183. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 166 and 173. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.

area.areaDesc: Lower Rio Grande Valley; San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; South Central Highlands
